remarks.format: ## Remarks 是的抽象基类的和，其中从流和字符串中分别读取字符。 is the abstract base class of and , which read characters from streams and strings, respectively. 若要打开文本文件，以便读取指定的范围的字符，或创建基于现有的流读取器，请使用这些派生的类。Use these derived classes to open a text file for reading a specified range of characters, or to create a reader based on an existing stream. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 完成后使用从此类型派生的任何类型的操作后，你应释放类型直接或间接。When you have finished using any type that derives from this type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，调用其中的方法`try` / `catch`块。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅释放和中的"使用实现 IDisposable 的对象"部分接口主题。For more information, see Dispose and the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. ## Examples 类是抽象类。The class is an abstract class. 因此，你不要实例化它在代码中。Therefore, you do not instantiate it in your code. 类派生自，用于从流中读取的成员的实现。The class derives from and provides implementations of the members for reading from a stream. 下面的示例演示如何通过使用读取文件中的所有字符方法。The following example shows how to read all the characters in a file by using the method. 它会检查每个字符之前将该字符添加到的实例中是否是字母、 数字或空格类。It checks whether each character is a letter, digit, or white space before adding the character to an instance of the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此实现的`Close`调用方法并将其传递`true`值。This implementation of `Close` calls the method and passes it a `true` value. 刷新的文本读取器不会刷新其基础的编码器，除非你明确地调用`Close`。Flushing the text reader will not flush its underlying encoder unless you explicitly call `Close`. 设置属性`true`意味着数据从缓冲区刷新到流中，但不是会刷新编码器状态。Setting the property to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 这将允许编码器，以便它可以正确编码的字符的下一步块保持其状态 （部分字符）。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 这种情况下会影响 UTF8 和 UTF7 编码器收到的相邻字符后才可以编码某些字符。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can be encoded only after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters. > [!NOTE] > 在派生类中，不会重写方法。In derived classes, do not override the method. 相反，重写方法以添加用于释放资源的代码。Instead, override the method to add code for releasing resources.
